New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Shohei Ohtani became the first big league player to hit three homers and steal two bases in a game
Shohei Ohtani became the first member of the 50-50 club (50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season)
Shohei Ohtani broke the Dodgers' franchise record of 49 homers set by Shawn Green in 2001
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 49th homer in the sixth inning, his 50th in the seventh and his 51st in the ninth
Shohei Ohtani stole his 50th and 51st bases in the first and second innings
Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Miami Marlins 20-4
Shohei Ohtani finished 6 for 6 with 10 RBIs
Post-Match Reflections: Miguel Rojas expressed a lot of emotions witnessing Ohtani's historic performance
Shohei Ohtani expressed pride in the performance and cherishing the moment
Will Smith praised Ohtani's work ethic and consistency
Tommy Edman noted Ohtani's unique skill set and consistency
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles Dodgers secured a playoff spot
Shohei Ohtani signed a $700 million, 10-year deal with the Dodgers last December
Shohei Ohtani played exclusively at designated hitter this season as he rehabilitates after surgery a year ago for an injured elbow ligament
